data.chText: 某次；…的时候
data.enText: a particular time when sth happens

data.chText: 这 / 那次
data.enText: on this/that occasion

data.chText: 我曾见过他几次。
data.enText: I've met him on several occasions.

data.chText: 我记得他因为健康不佳而被迫取消的情况绝无仅有。
data.enText: I can remember very few occasions when he had to cancel because of ill health.

data.chText: 他们有两次被人看见在一起。
data.enText: They have been seen together on two separate occasions .

data.chText: 有一次她深更半夜打电话给我。
data.enText: On one occasion, she called me in the middle of the night.

data.chText: 他利用这个机会宣布再次减税。
data.enText: He used the occasion to announce further tax cuts.

data.chText: 特别的事情（或仪式、庆典）
data.enText: a special event, ceremony or celebration

data.chText: 伟大的 / 难忘的 / 欢乐的庆典
data.enText: a great/memorable/happy occasion

data.chText: 要把每一顿饭都弄得特别一些。
data.enText: Turn every meal into a special occasion .

data.chText: 他们举办露天音乐会来庆祝这个特别的时刻。
data.enText: They marked the occasion (= celebrated it) with an open-air concert.

data.chText: 他们的婚礼办得相当隆重。
data.enText: Their wedding turned out to be quite an occasion.

data.chText: 他在退休时获赠这块手表。
data.enText: He was presented with the watch on the occasion of his retirement.

data.chText: 适当的机会；时机
data.enText: a suitable time for sth

data.chText: 原本应该是高兴的时刻，她却丝毫未感到快乐。
data.enText: It should have been an occasion for rejoicing, but she could not feel any real joy.

data.chText: 有机会的话，我要跟他谈谈这件事。
data.enText: I'll speak to him about it if the occasion arises (= if I get a chance).

data.chText: 理由；原因
data.enText: a reason or cause

data.chText: 我最近无缘去拜访他。
data.enText: I've had no occasion to visit him recently.

data.chText: 她的逝世引发了大规模的骚乱。
data.enText: Her death was the occasion of mass riots.

data.chText: 如果必要的话，我愿意就此出庭。
data.enText: I'm willing to go to court over this if the occasion arises (= if it becomes necessary) .
on occasion(s)

data.chText: 偶尔；偶然；有时
data.enText: sometimes but not often

data.chText: 大家都知道他有时会发脾气。
data.enText: He has been known on occasion to lose his temper.
a sense of occasion

data.chText: 隆重的（或特别的）气氛
data.enText: a feeling or understanding that an event is important or special

data.chText: 桌上点了一些蜡烛，使得那个晚上有一种特别的气氛。
data.enText: Candles on the table gave the evening a sense of occasion.

data.chText: 使发生；造成；导致
data.enText: to cause sth

data.chText: 这次航班的延误是由于必须做进一步的安全检查。
data.enText: The flight delay was occasioned by the need for a further security check.

data.chText: 这个决定让我们忧虑不堪。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: The decision occasioned us much anxiety.

simple_means.memory_skill: oc 加强 + cas 降临 + ion 表动作 → 使…降临 → 发生

means: 特别的事情(或仪式、庆典)

ex.enText: They had no opportunity/chance to escape.

ex.chText: 他获得了访问巴黎的机会。
ex.enText: He has got the opportunity/chance to visit Paris.

ex.chText: 对去年的毕业生而言，就业机会要多一些。
ex.enText: There were more opportunities for graduates last year.

synonyms.bx: 指能够做某事或容易做成某事的机会，作此义解时常可与 chance 换用；也可指得到工作或提升的机会。

ex.chText: 这是他唯一的逃脱机会。
ex.enText: It was his only chance of escape.

ex.chText: 我从不错过任何踢足球的机会。
ex.enText: I never miss a chance to play football.

ex.chText: 他将是下周竞选的候选人，这是他成功的大好机会。
ex.enText: He will be a candidate in next week's election, and this is his big chance.

synonyms.bx: 指做想做之事的适当时机，侧重指偶然或意外的机会。

ex.chText: 这是个举国欢庆的时刻。
ex.enText: This is an occasion for the whole country to celebrate.

ex.chText: 这是两位总统表达友谊的时机。
ex.enText: It was the occasion for expressing friendship by the two presidents.

synonyms.bx: 指合适的机会或有利的时机，通常用单数，常后接介词 for。

ex.chText: 现在正是我们搬到纽约去的好时机。
ex.enText: Now is the right time for us to move to New York.

ex.chText: 如果有时间我会去拜访她。
ex.enText: I'll visit her if I have time.

ex.chText: 现在不是换工作的时候。
ex.enText: This is no time to switch jobs.

synonyms.bx: 指能够用来做某事的一段时间，多用于口语。

data.enText: on occasion(s)

data.chText: 偶尔；偶然；有时
data.enText: sometimes but not often

data.chText: 大家都知道他有时会发脾气。
data.enText: He has been known on occasion to lose his temper.
a sense of occasion

data.chText: 隆重的（或特别的）气氛
data.enText: a feeling or understanding that an event is important or special

data.chText: 桌上点了一些蜡烛，使得那个晚上有一种特别的气氛。
data.enText: Candles on the table gave the evening a sense of occasion.

tr: an event that occurs at a critical time
example: at such junctures he always had an impulse to leave
it was needed only on special occasions
the party was quite an affair
an occasion arranged to honor the president
a seemingly endless round of social functions
there was no occasion for complaint
there was never an occasion for her to demonstrate her skill

tr: the time of a particular event
example: on the occasion of his 60th birthday

value.def: An occasion is a time when something happens, or a case of it happening.

example.ex: I often think fondly of an occasion some years ago at Covent Garden...
example.tran: 我时常愉快地回想起几年前在科文特花园的一个时刻。

example.ex: Mr Davis has been asked on a number of occasions.
example.tran: 戴维斯先生曾多次被问及。

value.def: An occasion is an important event, ceremony, or celebration.

example.ex: Taking her with me on official occasions has been a challenge...
example.tran: 带着她出席正式场合对我来说一直是个挑战。

example.ex: It will be a unique family occasion.
example.tran: 这将是一次特别的家庭聚会。

value.def: An occasion for doing something is an opportunity for doing it.

example.ex: It is an occasion for all the family to celebrate...
example.tran: 这是个值得举家庆祝的时刻。

example.ex: It is always an important occasion for setting out government policy.
example.tran: 这历来都是阐明政府政策的重要时机。

value.def: To occasion something means to cause it.

example.ex: He argued that the release of hostages should not occasion a change in policy.
example.tran: 他认为释放人质不应造成政策的改变。

value.def: If you have occasion to do something, it is necessary for you to do it.

example.ex: We have had occasion to deal with members of the group on a variety of charges.
example.tran: 我们有必要以多项罪名起诉该组织的成员。

value.def: If something happens on occasion, it happens sometimes, but not very often.

example.ex: He treated them seriously and, on occasion, entertained them hilariously...
example.tran: 他对待他们严肃认真，偶尔又逗得他们捧腹不已。

example.ex: He translated not only from the French but also, on occasion, from the Polish.
example.tran: 他不仅做法文翻译，有时也做些波兰语翻译。

value.def: If you say that someone rose to the occasion, you mean that they did what was necessary to successfully overcome a difficult situation.

example.ex: Inverness, however, rose to the occasion in the second half, producing some of the best football they have played for some time.
example.tran: 然而，因弗内斯队在下半场经受住了考验，踢出了很长一段时间以来的最佳水平。

value.tran: 成功应付困难局面；关键时刻发挥作用

trans: 在这种情况下；在这场合；在这个场合；这一次
在那个时候；在那个时机

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to fall, to drop, to fall down 落下；降临
rootsaffixes.title: cad, cas, cid, cay

partsOfSpeech.dec: cad 落下；降临 + ence 表行为 → 落下的〔声音〕→ 声音的抑扬
casc〔= cas〕落下；降临 + ade 表动作的结果 →〔水〕落下 → 小瀑布
cas 落下；降临 + ual 有…性质的 →〔没有准备〕降临的 → 偶然的
cas 落下；降临 + ual 有…性质的 + ty 表情况 →〔突然〕降临 → 事故
co 共同 + in 使… + cid 落下；降临 + e → 使一同降临 → 巧合
de 向下 + cad 落下；降临 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 向下堕落的 → 颓废的
de 向下 + cay 落下；降临 → 向下掉 → 衰退
de 加强 + cid 落下；降临 + uous …的 →〔树叶、表皮〕落下 → 落叶的；脱落的
in 使… + cid 落下；降临 + ent 表名词 → 使〔突然〕降临 → 偶然事件
oc 加强 + cas 落下；降临 + ion 表动作 → 使…降临 → 发生
oc 加强 + cid 落下；降临 + ent 表名词 →〔太阳〕落下的地方 → 西方
